sentence.Network_en: Lately, the president has been sacking and picking new ministers at whim.
sentence.Network_cn: 最近，总统一时兴起频频解雇旧部长，选任新部长。

sentence.Network_en: They've really been kicking ass lately — busting places up, harassing everybody.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们最近真是让人气不打一处来，闹得天翻地覆，搅得每个人都不得安宁。

sentence.Network_en: She feels guilty about spending less time lately with her two kids.
sentence.Network_cn: 最近她和两个孩子在一起的时间少了，她为此感到愧疚。

entry.def: You use lately to describe events in the recent past, or situations that started a short time ago.

example.ex: Dad's health hasn't been too good lately...
example.tran: 爸爸的健康状况近来不太好。

example.ex: Lord Tomas had lately been appointed Chairman of the Centre for Policy Studies...
example.tran: 托马斯勋爵最近被任命为政策研究中心主席。

entry.def: You can use lately to refer to the job a person has been doing until recently.

example.ex: ...Timothy Jean Geoffrey Pratt, lately deputy treasury solicitor...
example.tran: 新卸任的政府法务部副部长蒂莫西·琼·杰弗里·普拉特

sentences.sentence: "as late as yesterday she was fine"
"the spelling was first affected, but latterly the meaning also"

Sentence.sentence: As our special report in this issue (printed before Mr Jobs's death) explains, innovation used to spill over from military and corporate laboratories to the consumer market, but lately this process has gone into reverse.
